articles.author: NICK PERRY Associated Press
articles.title: North Americans adjust to Aussie lingo as they fight fires
articles.description: The U.S., Canada and New Zealand have sent hundreds of firefighters to Australia to help local crews battle its deadly wildfires
articles.content:
MORUYA, Australia -- 
Bimbimbie. Wamban. Ulladulla. 
Australia's place names can be a mouthful to pronounce, and it's one of the challenges that Canadian firefighter John Mash has faced after arriving to help battle the country's deadly wildfires. American … [+3797 chars]

articles.title: Group hopes to prevent “opossum dropping” on New Year’s Eve
articles.description: A movement is growing in North Carolina to prevent the act of so-called “opossum dropping
articles.content:
RALEIGH, N.C. -- 
A movement is growing in North Carolina to prevent the act of so-called opossum dropping. 
The practice involves suspending an opossum in a transparent box on New Years Eve and slowly lowering it the ground as people count down to midnight… [+734 chars]

articles.title: An Iranian general dies in a U.S. attack, and Canada suffers
articles.description: Canadians are struggling to come to terms with how the killing of an Iranian general last week in a U.S. drone stroke may have led to the deaths of dozens of their citizens in a plane crash
articles.content:
